subject: Re: [junit] Adding NotImplmented interface to JUnit
msgSnippet: ... I suppose it depends on intent. The JUnit-addons test runner reports ignored tests without actually executing them. Some people might find that valuable
messageBody:
Russell Gold wrote:

> On Sat, 25 Sep 2004 12:53:44 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger
> <jbrains@...> wrote:
> > As an alternative, use the JUnit-addons test runner, which ignores tests
> > whose names end in _ignored.
>
> As opposed to simply prepending a character or string to the test
> name, which would hide it from JUnit?

I suppose it depends on intent. The JUnit-addons test runner reports
"ignored" tests without actually executing them. Some people might find
that valuable in general, although I suppose in this case, it may not be
all that useful.

Thanks for reminding me of a simpler solution.

Take care.

--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
